title: TLD
summary: A TLD (top-level domain) is the most generic domain in the Internet's hierarchical DNS (domain name system). A TLD is the final component of a domain name, for example, "org" in developer.mozilla.org.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
